poem:
In Gaza

The air shakes
with the weight
of uncounted dreams—
17 fewer breaths under
an unyielding sky.

History folds
into silent faces,
broken steps,
while tanks move
like shadows—
unyielding,
unasked,
under a sky that neither knows
nor cares.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "At least 17 killed in Gaza refugee camps after latest Israeli strikes, say medics A series of Israeli airstrikes on Tuesday have resulted in the deaths of at least 17 Palestinians in two of the Gaza Strip’s historic refugee camps, as tanks advanced further into the southern city of Rafah, according to reports from residents and medics. Nuseirat and Bureij are home to families and descendants of people who fled to Gaza in the 1948". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: At least 17 killed in Gaza refugee camps after latest Israeli strikes, say medics A series of Israeli airstrikes on Tuesday have resulted in the deaths of at least 17 Palestinians in two of the Gaza Strip’s historic refugee camps, as tanks advanced further into the southern city of Rafah, according to reports from residents and medics. Nuseirat and Bureij are home to families and descendants of people who fled to Gaza in the 1948
